153.sentence: If, like me you simply want an iPod to play your mp3's, buy this one.

154.sentence: So reliability is the winner here for the iPod.

155.sentence: For looks, well iPod is head and shoulders better, both the iRiver and Creative Zen look positively ugly when next to a gleaming iPod.

156.sentence: The iPod package comes with everything you need, the AC adaptor, firewire cable (quicker than USB, but slower than USB 2 which it also gives), those snazzy and powerfull headphones, and of course the player.

157.sentence: Maybe this new design is more durable than the last, but I kind of doubt it.

158.sentence: We can start by losing the shiny miracle-material cover that you can literally scratch just by looking at it wrong, and thus eliminate the need for third-party "iSkin" protective covers for an extra thirty bucks.

159.sentence: First of all, I've never been big on earbuds - they're just not that comfortable.

160.sentence: These issues aside, the iPod is kind of like the cell phone in that once you have one, you can't be without one.

161.sentence: And if you're a Mac user like me, they've naturally made sure you have no viable alternative.

162.sentence: Also, you have to use it with iTunes - or they'll sue, dammit!  But iTunes is about as good as anything.

164.sentence: However, the battery life isn't as good as I would like.

166.sentence: All the "cool" features of the mini, but with 20GB instead of 5.

168.sentence: Has the click wheel and the ability to scan through thousnds of songs and organizes them great.

170.sentence: They fix the problem and help you with whatever your I-Pod needs Comes with two USB ports and a charger.
